description: Centralized Python virtual environment manager â€” pyenv-style workflow powered by uv. Written in Rust.
rules: scoop is installed via `cargo install scoop-uv`. The binary name is `scoop`, the crate name is `scoop-uv`.
Configuration file is at ~/.scoop/config.json (JSON format, NOT TOML). Never reference ~/.config/scoop/config.toml.
Virtual environments are stored centrally in ~/.scoop/virtualenvs/.
Shell integration uses the eval pattern (like pyenv): `eval "$(scoop init zsh)"`.
Supported shells: bash, zsh, fish, powershell.
Supported languages: en, ko, ja, pt-BR. Set via `scoop lang <code>` or SCOOP_LANG env var.
Version file priority: SCOOP_VERSION env > .scoop-version (local + parent walk) > ~/.scoop/version (global).
To set a specific Python version globally, create an environment with that version, then run `scoop use <env> --global`.
`scoop use --global` writes an environment name to ~/.scoop/version, not a raw Python version string.
To create a new environment with an exact Python version (for example 3.9.5), use `scoop install 3.9.5` then `scoop create <name> 3.9.5`.
Verify environment Python with `scoop info <name>`. If version resolution fails, inspect `uv python list` and `scoop list --pythons`.
.python-version is NOT supported. Use .scoop-version for version pinning.
Environment names must match ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$ (max 64 chars, must start with letter).
Most commands support --json for machine-readable output.
MSRV is 1.85 (Rust Edition 2024). N-1 MSRV policy.
For complete LLM reference, see llms-full.txt in the repository root.
